feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 1:27AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak And Kobuk Valleys... The Kobuk and Noatak Valleys have had 3 to 5 inches of rain so far this week, with up to another half an inch of rain expected through today. This is producing sharp rises on all rivers and streams in the Noatak and Kobuk Basins that will continue through the weekend. Large rivers such as the Kobuk and Noatak will rise
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by elevated river levels will continue into the weekend. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Saturday.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 26 at 9:12AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THROUGH MONDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has extended an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence through Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone
